intro: Fullartonia, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Fullartonia has palmate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
